question: Recently, India has been invited to 46th session of foreign ministers OIC. In this context, which of the following is not a correct statement?
option1: India is a member of OIC
option2: Official languages are Arabic, English, and French
option3: India is neither a member nor an observer
answer: India is a member of OIC
explanation: India has been invited to attend a meeting of foreign ministers of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) in Abu Dhabi, UAE on the 1st and 2nd March of 2019. External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj will be the Guest of Honour and address the inaugural plenary of the 46th Session of the Council of Foreign Ministers of OIC at the invitation of UAE Foreign Minister. This is the first time that a leader of the non-Muslim country has been invited to the OIC conference. The move will boost relations with West Asian and Muslim-majority nations. New Delhi sees the invitation as a milestone in the comprehensive strategic partnership with the UAE. It is also a welcome recognition of the presence of 185 million Muslims in India and of Indiaâ€™s contribution to the Islamic world.The official languages of the OIC are Arabic, English, and French.
